themes.label: Inventories
themes.rationale: The text is a detailed list of temple equipment, furniture, and votive offerings, typical of a sanctuary inventory.
themes.quote: ν τοι τες μν ας θυμιατ ρ[ι]α χαλκ. λυχνε ον χαλκον ν κρατρ ρ χαλκος

themes.label: Votive Dedications
themes.rationale: The items listed, such as statues, shields, and phialai, are characteristic of votive offerings dedicated to deities in a sanctuary.
themes.quote: χαλκον ν γαλμα π τες τραπ ζες

themes.label: Bronze
themes.rationale: Numerous items in the inventory are explicitly described as being made of bronze (chalkos).
themes.quote: θυμιατ ρ[ι]α χαλκ. λυχνε ον χαλκον

themes.label: Iron
themes.rationale: The text mentions several items made of iron, specifically pins (peronai) and stands.
themes.quote: σιδερα ε κοσι κα κατ ν

themes.label: Wood
themes.rationale: The inventory includes items made of wood, such as cypress wood statues and wooden thrones.
themes.quote: κυφαρ σινον ν μικρ ν γαλμα

themes.label: Shields
themes.rationale: The list includes bronze and white shields (aspis) as part of the temple's possessions.
themes.quote: μ α σπ ς π χαλκος μ α σπ ς λευκ μ α

rationale: This inscription is a temple inventory from Aegina, dating to the late 5th century BC. It provides a comprehensive list of ritual objects, furniture, and votive offerings belonging to the local cults of Mnia and Azesia, as well as Dionysus. The inventory specifies materials such as bronze, iron, and cypress wood, and lists items like incense burners, lampstands, kraters, statues, iron pins, shields, and thrones, some of which were kept in the opisthodomos (back room) of the temple. The text is fragmentary with several lacunae but the nature of the list is clear.
